Key Match Events: The Dodgers came back not once, but twice late to win Game 1.
The Yankees pushed the Dodgers to the final out of Saturday night’s Game 2.
Aaron Judge strikes out in the ninth inning of the Yankees’ 4-2 loss to the Dodgers in Game 2 of the World Series on Oct. 26, 2024.
Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees’ main advantage in the rotation wasn’t effective.
The Yankees wanted to win with the long ball and star power, but the Dodgers had the edge.
The Yankees’ plan in the offseason was Yama-Soto, but they ended up with different strategies.
Post-Match Reflections: Anthony Rizzo said the Dodgers have played really well and you can’t take anything away from them.
Aaron Boone mentioned that it’s a long series, and they need to make it a long series now.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees can take heart that the Dodgers may not have the presumptive NL MVP after Shohei Ohtani sustained an injury.
The Yankees can win this series by getting it back to Los Angeles, which means the 27 innings in The Bronx must be a lot better.
